001
002package com.commercetools.api.models.category;
003
004import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
005
006import java.util.*;
007
008import com.commercetools.api.models.Identifiable;
009
010/**
011 * All categories in the project, represented as an in-memory tree.
012 */
013public interface CategoryTree {
014    /**
015     * Root categories (the ones that have no parent).
016     *
017     * @return root categories
018     */
019    List<Category> getRoots();
020
021    /**
022     * Finds a category by id.
023     *
024     * @param id the ID of the category to search for
025     * @return category
026     */
027    Optional<Category> findById(String id);
028
029    /**
030     * Finds a category by its external ID.
031     *
032     * @param externalId the external id of the category to find
033     * @return optional
034     */
035    Optional<Category> findByExternalId(String externalId);
036
037    /**
038     * Finds a category by the slug and a specific locale.
039     * @param locale the locale
040     * @param slug the slug
041     * @return a category matching the criteria
042     */
043    Optional<Category> findBySlug(Locale locale, String slug);
044
045    /**
046     * Finds a category by the key.
047     * @param key the category key
048     * @return a category matching the criteria
049     */
050    Optional<Category> findByKey(String key);
051
052    /**
053     * All categories as a flat list.
054     *
055     * @return all categories
056     */
057    List<Category> getAllAsFlatList();
058
059    /**
060     * return the children for category. If there are no children or category is not in this {@link CategoryTree} then the list is empty.
061     *
062     * @param category the category which should be the parent category to the result list
063     * @return list of children or empty list
064     */
065    List<Category> findChildren(final Identifiable<Category> category);
066
067    /**
068     * Gets a list containing all categories that share a parent
069     * with at least one of the given categories.
070     *
071     * @param categoryIds Categories for which the sibling categories should be fetched
072     * @return a list of sibling categories
073     */
074    List<Category> findSiblings(final Collection<? extends Identifiable<Category>> categoryIds);
075
076    /**
077     * Gets the subtree of the given parent categories.
078     *
079     * @param parentCategories the list of parent categories to use as a starting point
080     * @return the subtree with the subcategories including the parent categories
081     */
082    CategoryTree getSubtree(final Collection<? extends Identifiable<Category>> parentCategories);
083
084    /**
085     * For a given category searches the ancestor that is in root level.
086     *
087     * @param category the category which to find the root ancestor
088     * @return the root ancestor of the category or the same category in case it is a root itself
089     */
090    Category getRootAncestor(final Identifiable<Category> category);
091
092    /**
093     * For a subtree the categories which are at the top level.
094     * <p>Unlike {@link #getRoots()} this does ignore the parent reference.</p>
095     *
096     * @return subtree roots
097     */
098    List<Category> getSubtreeRoots();
099
100    /**
101     * Creates a category tree from a flat list of categories.
102     *
103     * @param allCategoriesAsFlatList all categories as flat list.
104     * @return the created category tree.
105     */
106    static CategoryTree of(final List<Category> allCategoriesAsFlatList) {
107        requireNonNull(allCategoriesAsFlatList);
108        return CategoryTreeFactory.of().create(allCategoriesAsFlatList);
109    }
110}
